availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin C. Hord (Taylor County, Kentucky, bookkeeper and justice of the peace )

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, bookkeeper and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Margret Musgrove Hord. Father of Ann H. Hord, Henry H. Hord, Candes N. Hord, Stephen R. Hord, Mary F. Hord, Benjamin A. Hord, Richard Ferguson Hord, and Dolley Hord. Bookkeeper in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Justice of the peace in Taylor County, Kentucky, from December 10, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 359B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Precinct 3, p. 220B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 47A-B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #30710.
KYR-0001-031-0082.
